Posts.Content: Jun 12, 2008 08:46AM Tanzie wrote: Hey Heidi, Like Sue-- I can't really offer any advice. I'm fairly new here, and like you, I'm also wrestling with the lumpectomy vs. Mastectomy issue.  It's the hardest decision I've ever had to make.  I haven't posted much myself, but I have combed through the boards and the ladies here all are wonderfully encouraging.  Wishing you all the best, Lei
Posts.Title: Anyone? Lumpectomy vs. Mastectomy w/No Re-occurance???

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2008 07:06AM Tanzie wrote: Hey girly, I can't say 100 percent what tests you will be going through. But I would think, based on my experience that you are probably looking at Ultrasound, perhaps MRI and most likely a needle biopsy on the lumps.  Needle, or core biopsys only require a local, or at least mine did.  After the inital shot for pain all I felt was pressure. I went home with a bandaid and was sore afterwards, but it wasn't too bad really. As for your partner being allowed in? Well, I wouldn't think it would be a problem with anything except maybe the mri--- I was in the room alone with the machine during my breast MRI.  Hope this helps some!
Posts.Title: Is an operation on the cards? charmed-imsure Shirlann

Posts.Content: Tanzie wrote: Okay, I start chemo Sept ninth and will be getting my picc line in earlier that morning.  I've looked, but it seems like I am in the minority when it comes to this?   Anyone else here dealing with a picc line?  Anything I should worry about? I'm anxious about getting it inserted, since I was told I'd just be getting a local... I am only doing 4 tx of A/C, and my Onco wanted to spare me another scar.  Not to mention being knocked out again.  Anyone with any words of wisdom would be appreciated! Tanz ~*~I believe our adventure through time has taken a most serious turn. ~*~ Ted - Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure Dx 5/23/2008, IDC, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 1/1 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Bueller? Anyone? Tanzie badboob67

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2008 07:24PM Tanzie wrote: The tube idea isn't too shabby.  And I can sew.   I'll have to see what sorts of waterproof fabric I can find. Now that I think about it,  I bet that 'Press'N Seal' wrap would work even better than regular Saran does. I don't know about having a home nurse out to flush it.  I will be going to town every week anyway to get my fills. I might could just stop by the C. center and have them do it on my non-treatment week.  Anyway, nothing has been mentioned to me about it yet.  Perhaps they'll wait and tell me all that when I get it put in.   I'm having my first chemo right after I get my line... I guess focusing on the picc line is helping me keep my mind off the A/C. God bless and best of luck! Tanz
